alert.note: Alert for Clark; Fayette; Franklin; Greene; Madison; Pickaway (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 11:35AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHWESTERN FRANKLIN, NORTHEASTERN FAYETTE, WESTERN PICKAWAY, SOUTHEASTERN CLARK, EAST CENTRAL GREENE AND SOUTHERN MADISON COUNTIES THROUGH 1215 PM EDT... At 1135 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located 7 miles east of South Charleston, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts up to 35 mph, pea size hail, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Grove City, London, Mount Sterling, South Charleston, Bloomingburg, New Holland, Commercial Point, South Solon, Midway, Harrisburg, Orient, Darbyville, Newport, Deer Creek Lake, Chenoweth, Interstate 71 at State Route 38, Selma, Madison Mills, Gladstone and Madison Lake. This includes I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 71 and 98. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...35 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
